posts._title: Anatole Litvak – L’Équipage aka Flight into darkness (1935)
posts.title: L’Équipage
posts.excerpt: Filmmaker Anatole Litvak was still one year away from his “breakthrough” picture Mayerling when he co-wrote and directed L’Equipage (The Crew). Charles Vanel and Annabella star respectively as a daring WW I aviator and his loving but neglected wife. Ostracized by the other pilots because of his recklessness and standoffishness, Vanel nonetheless befriends a young …

posts._title: Vittorio De Sica – La porta del cielo (1945)
posts.title: La porta del cielo
posts.excerpt: SYNOPSISDuring War World II, Vittorio De Sica was approached by Goebbels to help relaunch the Italian film industry under the auspices of Musolini’s puppet regime. In order to escape collaboration with the Nazis, De Sica quickly invented the project “La porta del cielo” a film about religious miracles funded by the Vatican. Appalled by their …

posts.title: Reunion in France
posts.excerpt: IMDB:Frenchwoman Michele de la Becque, an opponent of the Nazis in German-occupied Paris, hides a downed American flyer, Pat Talbot, and attempts to get him safely out of the country.

posts.title: Michael
posts.excerpt: Quote:A protege of Michael Haneke, Markus Schleinzer’s “Michael” is a triumph of uneasy cinema. With an unorthodox level of restraint, the director tells the story of a dull office drone who keeps a kidnapped young boy locked in his house. Despite its subversive edge, “Michael” successfully drains the shock out of a frightening premise and …

posts._title: Jean Desvilles – Les Plaisirs Fous AKA Crazy Pleasures (1977)
posts.title: Les Plaisirs Fous
posts.excerpt: Jacque’s new secretary, Caroline, is at first cool and distant, but he soon changes her attitude. This is one of the best films from Alpha France.

posts.title: Mukhsin
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:The story takes place in Sekinchan, Sabak Bernam in 1993, revolving around the first love of a 10-year-old Orked when a 12-year-old boy, Mukhsin, comes with his elder brother and aunt to spend the school holidays in her village. Around this relatively simple plotline of a blossoming young romance between the film’s two young protagonists, …

posts.title: Wholly Communion
posts.excerpt: Whitehead’s breakthrough film, the documentation of the great Albert Hall Poetry Festival in ’65, which won him acclaim and awards. Shot handheld with only 45 minutes of stock (the finished film is 33 minutes), and presumably closely distilling much of the tension and event-ness of the celebrated ‘happening’. Verse luminaries include a bill-topping Allen Ginsberg …

posts._title: Emilio Fernández – Flor silvestre AKA Wild Flower (1943)
posts.title: Flor silvestre
posts.excerpt: Hal Erickson@allmovie.com:Completed before his immensely successful Maria Candelaria, Emilio Fernandez’ Flor Sylvestre was released second in the US-and not until two years after its initial Mexican release. Also known as Wildflower, the film features Fernandez himself as a character named Rogellio Torres. The lion’s share of the footage, however, is devoted to the romance between …

posts._title: Kaljo Kiisk, Yuli Kun – Vallatud kurvid AKA Venturous Curves (1959)
posts.title: Vallatud kurvid
posts.excerpt: Quote:The first Estonian wide-screen feature film directed by Juli Kun and Kaljo Kiisk is a pure situation comedy where twin sisters (both roles played by Terje Luik) are in the middle of passionate adventures during a motorbike competition. Vaike, a student and a motorbike racer, arrives at the racetrack where the bikes are already racing …

posts._title: István Dárday & Györgyi Szalai – A dokumentátor (1988)
posts.title: A dokumentátor
posts.excerpt: IMDB says:Raffael is the rich owner of a video store. His girlfriend, the attractive Chip works there. They make some extra by making illegal copies of pornographic and horror movies. It is Rambo’s duty to deliver the video cassettes to the customers. Raffael doesn’t know Chip and Rambo are lovers.
